business.title: Chipmaker TSMC returns to the list of world's 10 most valuable companies: Here’s what led to its comeback
business.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) has reclaimed a spot in the list of the world’s 10 most valuable companies, riding the optimism of the artificial intelligence (AI) boom. TSMC's stock rallied, elevating its market capitalisation to a record, making it higher than Broadcom. Analysts expect TSMC to further advance amid surging AI-related revenue and strong pricing power.

business.title: Meta Says It Anticipates Continued Growth Despite Tariffs
business.summary: The Silicon Valley company made the revenue projection as it reported a 35 percent rise in profit in the first quarter.

general.title: 'Violin of hope': Secret note hidden in Dachau-built musical instrument found after 80 years
general.summary: A message written from within Nazi concentration camp Dachau, which remained undiscovered for more than 80 years, has been found. It tells a tale of survival, craftsmanship, and reveals the only known musical instrument built inside the camp.

general.title: A portrait of solidarity: Raúl Belinchón’s stunning images of mud-covered volunteers in Spain
general.summary: After fatal floods swept through Spain in 2024, photographer Raúl Belinchón captured powerful portraits of mud-soaked volunteers, a series that later won acclaim at the Sony World Photography Awards.

general.summary: A South Texas community, mostly made up of SpaceX employees, voted 212 to 6 in favor of establishing a new city called Starbase.

general.title: Radiohead star Jonny Greenwood speaks out on cancelled shows with Israeli musician Dudu Tassa
general.summary: June concerts featuring Radiohead’s Jonny Greenwood and Israel-born Dudu Tassa have been cancelled after "credible threats". Greenwood has stated: "Intimidating venues into pulling our shows won't help achieve the peace and justice everyone in the Middle East deserves"

general.title: LUX Audience Award finalists discuss cinema and social change
general.summary: The 2025 edition of the LUX Audience Award features rich themes, stylistic and linguistic diversity. Co-productions and the creative process in cinema today were among the topics debated with the five finalists.

science.title: This man survived 200 snake bites, from cobras to mambas, and now his blood is helping scientists beat venom; know how
science.summary: Tim Friede, a former truck mechanic, intentionally subjected himself to numerous snakebites over two decades, aiming to develop immunity. His unusual experiment led to a breakthrough in antivenom research. Scientists discovered broadly neutralizing antibodies in Friede's blood, paving the way for a universal antivenom that could protect against various venomous snakes and save thousands of lives annually.

science.title: India now has everything to offer for science and research: Union minister Jitendra Singh
science.summary: Union Minister Jitendra Singh urged Indian researchers abroad to return, highlighting India's advancements in science and research. He emphasized a shift in national mindset and the need for industry-determined research with equitable financial commitments. India's global scientific presence is growing, reflected in its improved rankings in innovation, patent filings, and startup ecosystem, signaling a golden period for science.

science.title: How Nearly a Century of Happiness Research Led to One Big Finding
science.summary: Decades of wellness studies have identified a formula for happiness, but you won’t figure it out alone.

science.title: What is the ‘Black Hole Bomb’ theory and how scientists brought it to life in the lab
science.summary: Scientists at Southampton University have made a significant advancement. They have successfully simulated the 'Black Hole Bomb' theory in a lab. This theory, proposed in the 1970s, explores tapping into a black hole's rotational energy. The experiment involved a rotating cylinder and magnetic fields. The results showed energy changes based on relative rotation speeds.

environment.title: These tracking holidays offer ‘total immersion’ into the world of Europe’s wolves
environment.summary: Organisers say these wildlife experiences benefit wolf conservation by teaching about peaceful coexistence and habitat preservation.

environment.title: Left alone by humans, wildlife returns to the Eaton Fire burn area
environment.summary: In Altadena, four months after devastating wildfires, nature demonstrates remarkable resilience. Volunteers document the return of wildlife, including a mountain lion, to the Eaton Fire burn area. Despite the destruction, birdsong fills the air, and plant life is regenerating, offering hope to a community rebuilding after immense loss, showcasing nature's power to recover.

environment.title: Green Day receive star on Hollywood Walk of Fame with a heartfelt speech from Ryan Reynolds
environment.summary: The members of Green Day were honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, with actor Ryan Reynolds delivering a humorous and heartfelt tribute to the rock band.

environment.title: Limestone pinnacles, cypress trees and white cliffs: 4 European beaches among the best in the world
environment.summary: Two European beaches made the global top 10 for their stunning unspoilt nature.

kids.title: What is the 7-7-7 rule of effective parenting?
kids.summary: From ages 7 to 14, children are ready to learn more structured lessons. This is also the time for them to inculcate important life skills, values, and social behavior. At this point, parents should help their kids understand right from wrong, develop friendships, and explore their interests. This phase is also good for introducing ideas about faith, community, and responsibility.

kids.title: Happy Birthday David Beckham! Style and fashion icon celebrates turning 50
kids.summary: From football legend to fashion icon or business guru, David Beckham is the man many see as having it all. So, let's celebrate the former England captain marking his 50th birthday with a look at some of the iconic images from his life at the centre of attention.

culture.title: Nigerian autistic teen sets world painting record
culture.summary: A young autistic boy in Nigeria has broken the record for the world's largest art canvas - officially recognised by Guinness World Records. His canvas aims to highlight the challenges that people like him face amid stigma and grim depictions of autism.

culture.title: Nia Vardalos on bringing her acclaimed play to Athens — and performing for the first time in Greek
culture.summary: Nia Vardalos, star and writer of My Big Fat Greek Wedding, is bringing her acclaimed play Tiny Beautiful Things to Athens — and will perform in Greek for the first time. Euronews Culture sat down with Vardalos ahead of her Athens performance.

culture.title: 'Embrace': Czech artist reimagines Berlin’s Hamburger Bahnhof with monumental installation
culture.summary: Czech artist Klára Hosnedlová has transformed Berlin’s Hamburger Bahnhof with her largest exhibition to date, 'Embrace', featuring monumental tapestries, sculptures, and a soundscape inspired by her home near the Czech-Slovakian border.

culture.title: Armenian Haik Kazazyan wins top prize at inaugural Classic Violin Olympus competition in Dubai
culture.summary: From 12-to-1, Armenian violinist Haik Kazazyan has triumphed at the first-ever Classic Violin Olympus competition at Dubai’s Jumeirah Zabeel Saray, beating a world leading collection of classical music performers to win the coveted prize.

culture.title: Golden mosaics and giant frescoes: 4 art-filled churches to visit in Europe this year

culture.title: Rabindranath Tagore Jayanti: 10 timeless lines by him
culture.summary: Every year on May 7, the world celebrates Rabindranath Tagore Jayanti, a day dedicated to India’s first Nobel Laureate, an iconic poet, a skilled artist, and the most famous Polymath. And here we mention 10 lines by Tagore that are ever inspiring and beautiful.

travel.title: India conducts first trial flight of stratospheric airship platform
travel.summary: India's DRDO achieved a milestone with the successful maiden flight of its Stratospheric Airship Platform in Madhya Pradesh. The high-altitude airship, developed by ADRDE, ascended to 17 kilometers, transmitting sensor data for future improvements. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh lauded the achievement, emphasising its potential to enhance India's earth observation, intelligence, and surveillance capabilities.

technology.title: Climate solutions fund launched to support low carbon innovation in India
Eco-friendly aluminium surfaces show promise for industrial, biomedical uses
technology.summary: Indian researchers from Shiv Nadar University have developed a bioinspired aluminium surface that repels water, resists corrosion and bacteria, and self-cleans using minimal water. Mimicking lotus leaves and insect wings, the eco-friendly process creates superhydrophobic and antibacterial surfaces ideal for marine, healthcare, and packaging industries. The innovation promises scalable, low-cost applications with support from CSIR.

technology.title: AI, innovation and emerging markets: What to expect from Arabian Travel Market 2025
technology.summary: The annual tourism trade show returns to Dubai after a record-setting 2024 event, which saw 46,000 people attend.

teens.title: Teen Innovator Soars to New Heights: Mehar Singh Breaks Guinness World Record with Lightning-Fast Drone Ascent
West Bengal HS result 2025: Boys record a higher pass rate of 93%, while more girls score 60% and above
teens.summary: The West Bengal HS Examination 2025 results revealed an overall pass percentage of 90.79%, with 4,30,286 students passing. While male students achieved a slightly higher pass rate, female students outperformed males in the number of candidates scoring above 60% across all grade brackets. This trend highlights the increasing academic competitiveness of female students, particularly in urban areas and top-performing districts.

teens.title: Chhattisgarh Board CGBSE Class 10 and 12 toppers 2025: Ishika Bala and Naman Kumar Khuntia top Class 10, while Akhil Sen leads Class 12
teens.summary: The Chhattisgarh Board of Secondary Education (CGBSE) announced the 2025 Class 10 and 12 results, with Ishika Bala and Naman Kumar Khuntia topping Class 10, each securing 99.17%, while Akhil Sen emerged as the Class 12 topper with 98.20%. The results reflect exceptional academic performance, with students like Shruti Mangtani and Vaishali Sahu securing high ranks. The board's biannual exam system also provides students a second chance to improve their results.
